page.title: 16Easton Stoneworks
page.content: Portland limestone has been quarried and used since Roman and Saxon times. The particular carving capabilities of Portland Stone have provided a rich heritage of art and architecture. The greatest exponent of Portland Stone is to be found in the work of Sir Christopher Wren. The stoneworks at Easton is owned by Bath and Portland Stone Limited, the largest masonry company in the United Kingdom. The stoneworks employs 61 full time staff at the time of writing. The factory at Easton is the most advanced limestone works in Britain providing cut stone for projects as far afield as Northern Ireland, West Wales, Manchester, Cambridge, London and the Channel Islands. Relatively little carving of the classical decorative style is carried out in the stoneworks now.
